column4: hi guys im trying to do this to boot ubuntu, but do i need have only the ubuntu iso in the drive, im trying to load it from an external usb hd: http://www.howtogeek.com/howto/16822/boot-from-a-usb-drive-even-if-your-bios-wont-let-you/
hello?'
you need plop cd to boot the usb.

that's what it is but my question was, does my usb driver have to only have the ubuntu iso to load or can i have other documents in it, it's not a usb stick that im gonna be using but an external hard drive via USB
have you ever used a usb to install with?
to boot an os? no
is the usb a pendrive or a hard drive?
hard drive with the ubuntu iso and other files in it, like a typical internal hard drive. WHat will be the .ini file?
not a good way to try to install, works on occasion fails in others. Do you have a pendrive to use or a cd to burn and a reader?
reader?
im trying to look for a blank cd but all seems to be occupied
can your computer your installing to read=reader a cd, and can you burn one.
i can burn in this laptop yes but no blank cdr so far
do you have a pendrive, using the hard drive is more than just putting a ISO on it.
pendrive like a usb stick? no
are you sure that the computer will not bot a usb, how old is the compute?
becausae it doesn't have a usb option in the bios
okay, to be honest using a plop cd to boot a HD to install with is not easy and may fail. Do you even have plop on a cd?
how would we know.
not a ubuntu issue.
there is a #libreoffice channel as well if needed.
